sentences: Wilhelm Georg Berger (born 4 December 1929, Rupea; died 8 March 1993, Bucharest) was a Romanian composer, musicologist, violist and conductor.
Berger was born in Rupea, Romania.
He won the Prince Rainier III Composition Award in Monaco for a violin sonata in 1964, and First Prize in Li√®ge in 1965 for his Sixth String Quartet.
One of his violin concertos earned him the First Prize in Brussels in 1966.
